chapter_title: LAW 7 - GET OTHERS TO DO THE WORK FOR YOU, BUT ALWAYS TAKE THE CREDIT
summary: In this chapter, we learn the importance of leveraging the efforts of others while ensuring that the credit remains with us. The story of Nikola Tesla illustrates how innovation can be overshadowed by those who take the glory. The law advocates for using others' talents and skills to further our own aims, avoiding unnecessary exhaustion. It warns against naively believing that recognition will come if we work hard alone. Instead, one must strategically take credit for the work done to project an image of power and capability.

visual_theme.prompt: A cinematic exploration of innovation and overshadowed genius, featuring dark wood tones and intricate shadows. Antique machinery and scientific instruments create a nostalgic and atmospheric setting, while warm glows highlight the genius of forgotten inventors. The elegance of classical portraits blends with the efficiency of modern design, enriching the narrative of hidden struggles and triumphs in the world of invention.

slides.section_title: Leverage Others' Work for Your Success
slides.section_body: Harness the wisdom and efforts of those around you to advance your own objectives. This strategy not only preserves your energy but creates an image of efficiency. The true art lies in recognizing when and how to utilize others without overshadowing your own brilliance.
slides.quote: Never do yourself what others can do for you.

slides.section_body: Nikola Tesla's journey reveals how genius can be overlooked. Despite his groundbreaking inventions, he faced constant challenges in recognition and compensation. His story teaches us the value of securing credit for our contributions before they are claimed by others.
slides.quote: Tesla’s obsession was to create an alternating-current system of electricity.

slides.section_body: In the fable of the tortoise, we learn that strategic thinking leads to success. By using others to showcase strength, the tortoise not only proved himself equal but allowed others to do the heavy lifting while he took the credit—the key to effective leadership.
slides.quote: Never do what others can do for you.

slides.section_body: Edison mastered the art of utilizing others for his success. Rather than creating alone, he employed talented individuals and made their achievements his own. This principle of delegation forms the foundation of effective leadership in any field.
slides.quote: He was really a businessman and publicist.

slides.section_body: In the competitive world, those who dominate are often the ones leveraging the talents of others. Like vultures in the wild, they thrive on the creativity and efforts of others while appearing strong. This law emphasizes the necessity of adaptation to ensure your success.
slides.quote: Join the game instead of complaining.

slides.section_body: Nothing new is created in a vacuum. By standing on the shoulders of giants, you can claim the richness of past wisdom. Innovators like Newton and Shakespeare remind us that borrowing insights allows one to present themselves as extraordinary.
slides.quote: Standing on the shoulders of giants.

slides.section_body: In the tale of the blind hen, hard work does not equal reward without strategy. While one works tirelessly, another can prosper by using the efforts of others. The wisdom here is clear: be astute enough to channel the energy of those around you for your benefit.
slides.quote: Of what use was it to the industrious fool?

slides.section_body: To maintain control over your innovations, stay vigilant and protect your intellectual property. Ensuring that your work is recognized prevents others from stealing your credit. Proper recognition is crucial for future success and investment opportunities.

Effective leaders understand that empowering others is key to scaling success. By delegating responsibilities, they not only boost productivity but forge a reputation for brilliance. Learning to harmoniously blend efforts leads to victories that are attributed to you.
slides.quote: Find people with the skills and creativity you lack.

slides.section_body: Taking credit comes with the responsibility of knowing when to share it. Successful navigation of relationships can strengthen your position. Learning how to allocate credit wisely ensures lasting support and fortifies your standing in the competitive landscape.
slides.quote: Knowing when to share credit serves your purpose.
